
/* ECB tests for internal tables PERMA PERMAI PERMB PERMBI
   PERMA and PERMB each have 16 64-bit entries.
   PERMA is used for encrypting blocks of size 7-15 bits.
   Only the low-order 15 bits of PERMA entries are used.
   One encryption uses at least 30 table entries.
   PERMB is used for encrypting blocks of size 36-64 bits.
   All bits of PERMB are used.  One encryption uses 8 table entries.
   PERMAI and PERMBI are similar to PERMA and PERMB, but are for decryption.
   Only one key size is used, since key-size is irrelevant to the tables.
 */


=========================

FILENAME:  "ecb_tbl.txt"

Electronic Codebook (ECB) Mode
Tables Known Answer Test

Algorithm Name: Hasty Pudding Cipher
Principal Submitter: Rich Schroeppel

==========

KEYSIZE=128
BLOCKSIZE=15
ENCRYPTING
